SX0013/24 AIP SUPPLEMENT EDDF/FRA/FRANKFURT/MAIN VALIDITY: 21MAR24 - 30APR25 INSTALLATION OF A RIAS AT FRANKFURT MAIN AIRPORT TO INCREASE SAFETY WHEN XNG RWY 07C/25C, A RWY INCURSION ALERTING SYSTEM (RIAS) HAS BEEN INSTL ON TWYS M6 AND M30 IN ADDN TO THE EXISTING CAT II/III HLDG PSN INCLUDING STOP BAR. THIS SYSTEM IS ACT EVEN BY THE SLIGHTEST XNG OF THE ACT STOP BAR AND ALERTS THE PILOT. FST, THE ACFT APPROACHING THE CAT II/III HLDG PSN IS DETECTED BY A MICROWAVE SENSOR SYSTEM. IN CASE OF AN UNAUTHORISED XNG OF THE ACT STOP BAR, FOUR VERY BRIGHT, FLG RED SFC LGT AT THE CAT I HLDG PSN AS WELL AS TWO RED LGT EACH ON BOTH SHOULDERS OF TWY BTN THE CAT I AND CAT II/III HLDG PSN ARE ACT. THE LGT IS DIRECTED TOWARDS THE PILOT AND THUS ALERTS THE PILOT OF AN IMMINENT RWY INCURSION. IN ADDN, THE ATC TWR CONTROLLERS ARE ALERTED

DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (DPI) MSG PROVIDED TO NETWORK MANAGER OPERATIONS CENTER (NMOC). 1.1. ADS-B DATA REQUIRED 1.1.1. FOR ADS-B DATA USED BY THE AD OPERATOR AND EUROCONTROL, PILOTS OF AIRCRAFT EQUIPPED WITH MODE S AND ADS-B FUNCTIONALITY MUST, WHEN OPERATING ON THE GROUND: A) SELECT AUTOMATIC MODE AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A, OR B) IF AUTOMATIC MODE IS NOT AVAILABLE, SELECT ON AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A - FROM THE REQUEST OF PUSH-BACK. - AFTER LANDING, UNTIL THE AIRCRAFT HAS STOPPED ON HIS STAND. - WHEN THE AIRCRAFT IS FULLY PARKED, THE PILOT SHALL SELECT STBY. 1.1.2. WHEN THE AIRCRAFT IS CAPABLE OF COMMUNICATING ITS IDENTIFICATION (I.E. THE CALLSIGN USED IN FLIGHT), THIS MUST BE ENTERED (VIA THE FMS OR TRANSPONDER CONTROL PANEL) AT THE TIME OF THE PUSH-BACK REQUEST. 1.1.3. THE CREW MUST USE THE FORMAT DEFINED BY ICAO TO ENTER THE AIRCRAFT IDENTIFICATION. 1.1.4. IN ORDER NOT TO COMPROMISE THE PERFORMANCE OF SYSTEMS BASED ON SSR FREQUENCIES (INCLUDING AIRBORNE TCAS AND SSR RADARS), TCAS SHOULD NOT BE SELECTED BEFORE RECEIVING CLEARANCE TO LINE UP, AND SHOULD BE DESELECTED AFTER VACATING THE RUNWAY.

PROCEDURES FOR THE ORDERLY MOVEMENT OF ACFT ON APN ARE SUBJ BELOW CHANGES PRECISELY DESCRIBED AND REFERENCED TO THE APPROPRIATE AIP PARAGRAPHS OF AD 2 LIMC 1-18 TABLE 20 'LOCAL AD REGULATIONS' ITEM 2 'APRON'. WHAT IS NOT MENTIONED IS UNCHANGED. PENDING THE INCLUSION OF THESE CHANGES IN RELEVANT UPCOMING AIRAC AMDT, THE COMPLETE UPDATED DESCRIPTION OF THE WHOLE PROCEDURE IS AVAILABLE ON REQUEST TO AD OPR USING ONE OF THE FLW CHANNELS: -EMAIL RST(A)SEAMILANO.EU -PHONE +390274862313 -WEB ADDRESS HTTPS://EXT.EUROCONTROL.INT/AIRPORT(UNDERSCORE)CORNER(UNDERSCORE) PUBLIC/EVENTS(LOWER CASE) SECTION LIMC-MXP:MILANO MALPENSA. MENTIONED CHANGES ARE THE FLW: FREQ 131.880MHZ IS AVAILABLE H24 FOR AD OPR 'SEA' WITH CALLSIGN 'MALPENSA OPERATIONS' (PARAGRAPH 2.1.2 'CALL SIGN AND FREQ') AND SHALL BE USED BY PILOTS OF DEP ACFT, AFTER COMPLETING ALL HANDLING OPERATIONS AND CONFIRMING TOBT CONSISTENCY WITH THE RAMP AGENT, TO REPORT 'READY' SPECIFYING THE STAND AND THE FLIGHT NUMBER. MALPENSA OPERATIONS, AFTER CHECKING 'READY' STATUS, WILL ISSUE THE ARDT (ACTUAL READY TIME) AND WILL PROVIDE THE PILOT WITH THE CURRENT TSAT, THEN PILOTS SHALL REQUEST STARTUP CLEARANCE TO TWR DELIVERY OR GROUND FREQ ACCORDING TO OPR HR. FLIGHTS MUST BE 'READY TO MOVE' AT TOBT, HOWEVER, ARDT CAN BE GRANTED BY MALPENSA OPS WITHIN RANGE TOBT PLUS 5 MINUTES (PARAGRAPH 2.1.5 LIMITATIONS/REGULATIONS ON APN' POINT 'A' AND 2.2.2 'MILESTONES' POINT D 'ARDT'). TWR DELIVERY FREQ SHALL BE MONITORED BY PILOTS AFTER INSERTION OF A NEW TOBT (PARAGRAPH 2.2.2 'MILESTONES' POINT E 'ASAT AND AOBT'). FOR NON A-CDM DEP PROC - FAILURE OR SUSPENSION (PARAGRAPH 2.2.6), WHEN READY TO MOVE ACCORDING TO THE EOBT, PILOTS WILL CONTACT MALPENSA OPS, INSTEAD OF RAMP AGENT, SPECIFYING THE STAND AND THE FLIGHT NUMBER. AIRCRAFT WITH RADIO FAILURE MUST OPERATE AS FOLLOWS: DEPARTING AIRCRAFT CONTINUE STRICTLY ON THE ASSIGNED TAXI ROUTE TO THE CLEARENCE LIMIT AND WAIT FOR THE ARRIVAL OF THE FOLLOW-ME VHEICLE IN ORDER TO BE GUIDED TO THE PARKING STAND. ARRIVING AIRCRAFT - IF HAS ALREADY RECEIVED TAXIING INSTRUCTIONS, CONTINUES STRICTLY ON THE ASSIGNED TAXI ROUTE, TO THE CLEARENCE LIMIT AND WAIT FOR THE ARRIVAL OF THE FOLLOW-ME VHEICLE IN ORDER TO BE GUIDED TO THE PARKING STAND OR, IF HAS BEEN INSTRUCTED PROCEED TO THE PARKING STAND. - IF THE FAILURE OCCURS IN FLIGHT OR IN ANY CASE NO TAXIING INSTRUCTIONS HAVE BEEN RECEIVED: - IF IT RECEIVES SPECIFIC INSTRUCTIONS, VIA LIGHT SIGNALS, IT CLEARS THE LANDING AREA AND WAITS FOR THE FOLLOW-ME VHEICLE IN ORDER TO BE GUIDED TO THE PARKING STAND. - IF IT DOES NOT RECEIVE THESE INSTRUCTIONS VIA LIGHT SIGNALS (FOR EXAMPLE IN THE CASE OF REDUCED VISIBILITY) IT STOPS ON THE RUNWAY, AT THE FIRST AVAILABLE LINK, AND IN ANY CASE BASED ON ANY KNOWN RESTRICTIONS, WAITS FOR THE FOLLOW-ME VHEICLE IN ORDER TO BE GUIDED TO THE PARKING STAND. NOTE: THE INSTRUCTION TO CLEAR THE LANDING AREA, PROVIDED VIA LIGHT SIGNALS, DOES NOT IMPLY CONSTRAINTS ON THE ROUTE TO FOLLOW AND THEREFORE CAN ONLY BE USED WHEN COMPATIBLE WITH THE TRAFFIC SITUATION IN PROGRESS IN THE MANEUVERING AREA REF AIP AD 2 LIPK 1-13

WITH REFERENCE TO ITALIAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY (ENAC)PROVISION 4 JUN 2024, DUE TO REDUCED AVAILABILITY OF AIRCRAFT PARKING STANDS FOR NOT SCHEDULED FLIGHTS, THE MANAGEMENT OF DIVERTED FLIGHTS ON ARRIVAL WILL TAKE PLACE AS FOLLOWS: 1)IN ORDER TO SAFEGUARD THE AVAILABILITY OF PARKING STANDS FOR FLIGHTS REGULARLY SCHEDULED AT THE AIRPORT, THE DIVERTED FLIGHTS, AFTER LANDING, WILL BE PARKED ON THE APRON ONLY IN THE PRESENCE OF APPROPRIATE PARKING STANDS AVAILABLE FOR AT LEAST 2 HOURS (OR EVEN LONGER DEPENDING ON CURRENT OPERATIONAL SITUATION). IN THE ABSENCE OF SUCH TIPOLOGY OF AIRCRAFT STAND, DIVERTED FLIGHTS COULD BE SUBJECT TO LONG LASTING WAIT IN THE MOVEMENT AREA (EVEN A FEW HOURS), WITHOUT THE POSSIBILITY OF DISEMBARKING PASSENGERS, BAGS AND FREIGHT 2)THE CREW OF DIVERTED FLIGHTS PARKED IN THE MOVEMENT AREA ARE REQUESTED TO CONTACT HANDLER'S VHF FREQUENCY TO COMMUNICATE ANY REDUCTION IN EXPECTED ETD FROM THE AIRPORT, IN ORDER TO ALLOW THE AERODROME OPERATOR TO RE-EVALUATE THE AVAILABILITY OF AIRCRAFT STANDS ON THE APRON REF AIP AD 2 LIPE 1-23 ITEM 2.20 'LOCAL AERODROME REGULATIONS'

WITHIN ITALIAN AIRSPACE GAS BALLOONS AND HOT AIR BALLOONS SHALL APPLY VISUAL FLIGHT RULES ACCORDING TO THE CURRENT VERSION OF REGULATION (UE) NR. 923/2012 'SERA', AS APPLICABLE. 2. IN ADDITION TO AND ACCORDING TO ENAC (ITALIAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY) REGULATION 'RULES OF THE AIR ITALY', FOLLOWING PROVISIONS ARE IN FORCE FOR NIGHT VFR OPERATIONS WITHIN ITALIAN AIRSPACE: A. PILOTS SHALL BE QUALIFIED TO CONDUCT NIGHT VFR ACTIVITY B. AIRCRAFT SHALL BE CERTIFIED FOR OPERATING NIGHT VFR BY OWN STATE OF REGISTRATION C. BELOW 3000FT AMSL / 1000FT AGL PILOTS SHALL MAINTAIN CONTINUOUS SIGHT OF THE SURFACE DURING THE FLIGHT D. FOR MOUNTAINOUS AREAS FLT VISIBILITY SHALL NOT BE LESS THAN 8KM E. SSR TRANSPONDER MODE 'A' AND 'C', DOUBLE COMMUNICATIONS EQUIPMENT AND 'ELT' DEVICE ARE REQUIRED 3. CONTINUOUS TWO-WAY RADIO CONTACT SHALL BE MAINTAINED WITH THE APPROPRIATE ATS UNIT. 4. OPERATIONS CONDUCTED WITHIN AIRSPACES CLASSIFIED 'A', 'C', 'D', 'E' AND IN THE AERODROME TRAFFIC ZONES (ATZ) OF CONTROLLED AIRPORTS SHALL BE AUTHORIZED BY THE APPROPRIATE ATS UNIT. IN CONTROLLED AIRSPACE ALTITUDE/LEVEL CHANGES SHALL BE AUTHORIZED BY THE APPROPRIATE ATS UNIT. 6. GAS BALLOONS OPERATION ARE STRICTLY FORBIDDEN WITHIN FOLLOWING AREA: - MILANO AND ROMA TERMINAL CONTROL AREA (TMA) - ROMA CTR - WITHIN PORTION OF MILANO ACC AREA OF RESPONSIBILITY NORTH OF 450000N - CTA MILANO 6 'BUSSETO'- CTA MILANO 8 'EMILIA'- CTA MILANO 9 'LIGURIA' 7. DURING DAYTIME GAS BALLOONS OPERATION ARE STRICTLY FORBIDDEN WITHIN PADOVA CTA PORTION NORTH OF 440000N 8. RESTRICTED (R) AND DANGER (D) AREAS, TSA (TEMPORARY SEGREGATED AREA) AND TRA (TEMPORARY RESERVED AREA) SHALL BE AVOIDED DURING TIME OF ACTIVATION UNLESS SPECIFIC AUTHORIZATION IS ISSUED BY THE RELEVANT ATS UNIT 9.GAS BALLOON OPERATIONS SHALL NOT BE ALLOWED IF SSR TRANSPONDER INOPERATIVE 10. ACT SUBJ PRIOR COOR WITH MILANO ITALIAN AIR FORCE COORDINATION AND CONTROL SERVICE (SCCAM) AND PADOVA ACC 11. AX0002/24 AIC RESTRICTION HLLL/TRIPOLI FIR VALIDITY: 02OCT-UFN IATA IN FLIGHT BROADCAST PROCEDURE (IFBP) - AFI REGION 1.LISTENING WATCH IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT A LISTENING WATCH SHOULD BE MNTN ON THE DESIGNATED FREQ (126.9MHZ), 10 MIN BFR ENTERING THE DESIGNATED AIRSPACE TIL LVE THE AIRSPACE. FOR AN ACFT TKOF FM AN AD LOCATED WI THE LATERAL LIMITS OF THE DESIGNATED AIRSPACE, LISTENING WATCH SHOULD START AS SOON AS APPROPRIATE AND BE MNTN TIL LVE THE AIRSPACE. 2.BROADCASTS INTERVALS IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT A BCST SHOULD BE PRONOUNCED IN ENGLISH AS FLW: -10 MIN BFR, ENTERING AN FIR WI THE IFBP REGION -UPON ENTERING AN FIR WI THE IFBP REGION -AS SOON AS PRACTICABLE WHEN DEP FM AN AD LOCATED WI THE IFBP REGION -10 MIN BFR XNG OR JOINING AN ATS RTE OR XNG AN AWY OR WPT -EV 20 MIN -BFR A CHANGE IN FL -UPON RCH THE INTENDED FL -AT ANY OTHER TIME CONSIDERED NECESSARY BY THE PILOT. NOTE 1: IN THE INTEREST OF REDUCING CONGESTION ON THE IFBP FREQ, PILOTS MAY EXER DISCRETION TO OMIT CLOSELY SPACED REPETITIVE IFBP REPORTS, HOWEVER BCST INTERVALS SHOULD NOT EXCEED 20 MIN. NOTE 2: IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT THE IFBP FREQ 126.9 IS CLOSELY MNT AT ALL TIMES WHEN IN THE REGION; FOR EXAMPLE, NOT TO TURN OFF OR REDUCE VOLUME LEVELS ON THE TRANSMITTING/RECEIVING FREQ. 3.BROADCAST PROCEDURE IT IS RECOMMENDED A BCST MSG SHOULD BE STRUCTURED AS FLW: ALL STATIONS THIS IS ABC123 (FLT NR) IN THE XXXX (FIR NAME) FIR. ABC123 (FLT NR) AT FL (ALT MNTN) DIRECTION BOUND (DIRECTION) IN THE XXXX (FIR NAME) FIR. 4. OPERATING PROCEDURES 4.1. CHANGES IN CRUISING LVL ARE CONSIDERED NECESSARY BY PILOTS TO AVOID TFC CONFLICTS, FOR WEATHER AVOIDANCE, OR OTHER VALID OPR REASONS. WHEN CRUISING LVL CHANGES ARE UNAVOIDABLE, ALL AVBL ACFT LGT, WHICH WOULD IMPR THE VISUAL DETECTION OF THE ACFT, SHOULD BE DISPLAYED WHILE CHANGING LEVELS. 4.2. COLLISION AVOIDANCE IF, ON RECEIPT OF A TFC INFO BCST FM ANOTHER ACFT, A PILOT TAKES A DECISION THAT IMMEDIATE ACTION IS NECESSARY TO AVOID AN IMMINENT COLLISION RISK TO HIS ACFT AND THIS CANNOT BE ACHIEVED FLW THE RIGHT-OF-WAY PROVISIONS OF ANNEX 2, HE SHOULD: UNLESS AN ALTERNATIVE MANEUVER APPEARS MORE APPROPRIATE, CLIMB OR DESCEND 500FT; DISPLAY ALL AVBL ACFT LGT WHICH WOULD IMPR THE VISUAL DETECTION OF THE ACFT; ASAP REPLY TO THE BCST ADVISING ACTION BEING TAKEN, AND SPECIFY ALT MNTN; NOTIFY THE ACTION TAKEN ON THE APPROPRIATE ATS FREQ; AS SOON AS THE SITUATION HAS BEEN RECTIFIED, RESUME THE ALLOCATED FL, NOTIFYING THE ACTION ON THE APPROPRIATE ATS FREQ. 4.3. NORMAL POSITION REPORTING PROCEDURES NML PSN REP PROC SHOULD BE CONT AT ALL TIMES, REGARDLESS OF ANY ACTION TAKEN TO INITIATE OR ACK A TFC INFO BCST. 4.4. OPERATION OF TRANSPONDERS PILOTS SHALL ENSURE THAT TRANSPONDER PROC AS CONTAINED IN ICAO PANS OPS DOC 8168 ARE COMPLIED WITH AND IN THE ABSENCE OF OTHER DIRECTIONS FM ATC, OPR THE TRANSPONDER ON MODE A AND C CODE 2000. PILOTS SHALL ENSURE OPERATION OF TRANSPONDERS EVEN WHEN OUTSIDE RADAR COVERAGE IN ORDER TO ENABLE TCAS EQUIPPED ACFT TO IDENTIFY CONFLICTING TFC. USE OF TCAS IN ACCORDANCE WITH ICAO ANNEX 6 ALL TURBINE-ENG AIRPLANES OF A MAX CERTIFICATED TKOF MASS IN EXCESS OF 5700 KG OR AUTH TO CARRY MORE THAN 19 PAX SHALL BE EQUIPPED WITH ACAS II. IATA RECOMMENDS THE USE OF AN OPERABLE TCAS WHEN OPR WI THE CONTINENT OF AFRICA; AND RECOMMENDS SELECTION OF TA/RA MODE AT MAX RANGE. 4.5. USE OF SLOP: SLOP IS PROMOTED IN AFI REGION. 5. THE IFBP IN AFI IN MANY FIRS IN THE AFI REGION COM BOTH FIXED AND MOBILE HAVE EITHER NOT BEEN IMPLEMENTED OR OPR WELL BLW THE REQUIRED RELIABILITY. THIS HAS AN IMPACT ON THE PROPER PROVISION OF ATS, ESPECIALLY FIS. CONSEQUENTLY, THE AFI REGIONAL TECHNICAL CONFERENCE HAS DECIDED THAT THE IATA IN-FLT BCST PROC (IFBP) SHOULD BE USED WI DESIGNATED FIRS IN THE REGION AS AN INTERIM MEASURE TIL SUCH TIME AS COM FAC AFFECTING THE FIRS IN QUESTION HAVE BEEN IMPROVED. 6. DESIGNATED FREQ IN AFI FOR THE IFBP IS 126.9 MHZ. 7. IN THE AFI REGION THE IFBP SHOULD BE APPLIED IN THE FLW FIRS AND AIRSPACES: ASMARA, BRAZZAVILLE, KANO, KHARTOUM, KINSHASA, LUANDA, LUSAKA, TRIPOLI, MOGADISHU, NIAMEY, N DJAMENA, DAKAR.
